org.artificial_neural_networks.networks.lamstar
Class LamstarInputLayer

java.lang.Object
  org.artificial_neural_networks.common.Layer
      org.artificial_neural_networks.networks.lamstar.LamstarInputLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class LamstarInputLayer
extends org.artificial_neural_networks.common.Layer
implements java.io.Serializable

Version:
0.1 This class represents the abstraction of a LAMSTAR input layer. It is a container of SOM neurons.
Author:
Riccardo Cattaneo
See Also:

Constructor Detail

LamstarInputLayer

public LamstarInputLayer(double pTolerance,
                         long pID)
This is the default constructor.

Parameters:
pTolerance - is the maximum allowed distance between two neurons. If a new example is presented to the network, a new neuron is created iif there is no neuron whose distance from this example is less than pTolerance.
pID - the unique ID of the layer. Uniquenessmust be guaranteed in the network among all the layers.

LamstarInputLayer

public LamstarInputLayer(java.util.ArrayList<org.artificial_neural_networks.common.Neuron> pNeurons,
                         double pTolerance,
                         long pID)
                  throws org.artificial_neural_networks.exceptions.NotEnoughNeuronsException
This constructor takes an ArrayList and creates a layer out of it.

Parameters:
pNeurons - an ArrayList of Neuron.
pTolerance - is the maximum allowed distance between two neurons. If a new example is presented to the network, a new neuron is created iif there is no neuron whose distance from this example is less than pTolerance.
pID - the unique ID of the layer. Uniquenessmust be guaranteed in the network among all the layers.
Throws:
org.artificial_neural_networks.exceptions.NotEnoughNeuronsException

applyInputGetBestNeuronID

public long applyInputGetBestNeuronID(double[] inputVector)
                               throws org.artificial_neural_networks.exceptions.InputErrorException,
                                      org.artificial_neural_networks.exceptions.NotEnoughNeuronsException
This method returns the ID of the neuron inside this layer which is best describing the input.

Parameters:
inputVector - the vector of doubles that represents the input vector
Returns:
the ID of the neuron inside this layer whose response to the input is maximum
Throws:
org.artificial_neural_networks.exceptions.InputErrorException - this exception is thrown if there is any kind of error with the input (dimension-related)
org.artificial_neural_networks.exceptions.NotEnoughNeuronsException - this exception is thrown whenever the layer doesn't contain any neurons

applyInputGetBestNeuronID

public long applyInputGetBestNeuronID(org.artificial_neural_networks.common.NeuralVector inputVector)
                               throws org.artificial_neural_networks.exceptions.InputErrorException,
                                      org.artificial_neural_networks.exceptions.NotEnoughNeuronsException
This method returns the ID of the neuron inside this layer which is best describing the input.

Parameters:
inputVector - the NeuralVector that represents the input vector
Returns:
the ID of the neuron inside this layer whose response to the input is maximum
Throws:
org.artificial_neural_networks.exceptions.InputErrorException - this exception is thrown if there is any kind of error with the input (dimension-related)
org.artificial_neural_networks.exceptions.NotEnoughNeuronsException - this exception is thrown whenever the layer doesn't contain any neurons
